p: Mosquitoes are vectors of many pathogens that threaten the health of humans and animals worldwide [ 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6]. Patterns of mosquito species composition and abundance are influenced by environmental factors, such as temperature, humidity and the availability of suitable breeding sites [ 7], which usually vary across seasons. Seasonality also directly affects larval development and mosquito adult abundance and, therefore, indirectly affects disease transmission [ 8].
